Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Shay Mavis at 269-243-2725.
Sincerely,
Erica Marshall, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth was hurt during a restraint and shoved into a wall less
than a month ago.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 4/18/25. There
were no additional concerns.
Youth A was interviewed face to face on 4/21/25 at Vista
Maria. Youth A reported she tried to AWOL from the facility with
Youth C and broke a window while doing so. Youth A reported she
kicked out a window with the plan to climb out of it. Youth A
reported Staff 1 attempted to intervene by getting in her face.
Youth A reported Staff 1 shoved her into the wall. Youth A
reported she told Staff 1 "get the fuck out of my face". Youth A
reported she hit Staff 1 in the face. Youth A reported Staff 1 and
Staff 2 continued to yell at her. Youth A reported she grabbed a
piece of glass from the broken window and cut herself and
threatened Staff 1 and Staff 2 with a piece of glass. Youth A
reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 restrained her to take the piece of
glass away. Youth A reported she bumped her head on the wall
and scraped her knuckles while trying to resist the restraint.
Youth B was interviewed on 4/30/25 in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported she was not present to
witness the incident with Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed via face to face on 4/21/25 at Vista
Maria. Youth C reported she and Youth A were trying to AWOL by
breaking out the facility window on their wing. Youth C reported
Youth A was restrained because she had a piece of glass. Youth
C was uncertain as to which staff was involved in the incident.
Youth C reported Youth A was not shoved into the wall.
Staff 1 was interviewed via face to face on 5/1/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported being
present when Youth A broke the window in efforts to AWOL. Staff
2

1 reported Youth A broke a piece of glass from the window and
tried to self-harm. It was also reported Youth A was threatening to
harm staff with the glass. Staff 1 denied shoving Youth A against
the wall. Staff 1 reported he and Staff 3 were able to restrain
Youth A to get the glass out of Youth A hands. Staff 1 reported he
and Staff 3 grabbed pillows as a barrier to block Youth A from
hurting them or any other staff with the glass.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face on 5/1/25 in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported being present when the
incident occurred. Staff 2 reported Youth A ran around the facility
kicking walls and breaking windows. Staff 2 reported Youth A took
a piece of glass to self-harm and threatened to harm staff. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 and Staff 3 restrained Youth A to remove the
glass from Youth A hand successfully. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was not shoved against the wall but moved towards the window
during this restraint. Staff 2 also noted Staff 3 was holding Youth
A too tightly, so Staff 2 stepped in, de-escalated the situation, and
directed Staff 3 to step away.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face on 5/1/25 at Vista Maria in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 was not very
cooperative during the interview. He appeared to be agitated.
Staff 3 denied being a part of the restraint to remove the glass
from Youth A hand but reported being present. Staff 3 reported
Youth A punched out glass and walls during this incident. Staff 3
reported Youth A may have sustained injuries due to punching a
window out when she was trying to AWOL. Staff 3 reported Youth
A kicked him in groin during the incident, but he did not receive
medical attention. Staff 3 denied calling Youth A derogatory name
during this incident. Staff 3 reported he did not hear any other staff
call Youth A out of her name. Staff 3 reported Youth A received
medical attention for this incident.
Consumers Rights Advocate was interviewed on 5/1/25 via
face to face in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
It was reported Staff 3 would be terminated as he has been a part
of several complaints. Staff 3 was terminated on 5/1/25 due to this
misconduct.
Therapist was interviewed on 4/21/25 face to face at Vista
Maria. Therapist reported Youth A participates in weekly individual
therapy. Therapist denied Youth A told her about the pain to her
arm or head. Therapist reported youth in their facility received
medical exams when necessary. Therapist denied Youth A has
been denied medical treatment or mental health treatment.
3

Therapist reported being unaware of Youth A has been denied
access to medical assistance.
Staff 14 was interviewed via telephone on 7/9/2025. Staff 14
reported witnessing Youth A kick Staff 3 in the groin. According to
Staff 14, Staff 3 responded by kicking Youth A in retaliation. Staff
14 reported no other staff members were physically engaged with
Youth A or Youth B. Staff 14 reported Staff 5, who is the CPI
skilled trainer, was onsite during this incident and assisted with
this incident. Staff 14 reported Staff 5 was able to intervene in on
the incident with Staff 3.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 7/9/2025. Staff 4
reported observing the incident with Youth A and Youth B. Staff 4
reported Youth A and Youth B were upset but the reason is
unknown. Staff 4 reported witnessing Youth A punch Staff 1 and
reported Staff 1 pushed Youth A as a reflex. Staff 4 reported the
incident was chaotic and Staff 1 along with many other staff
(couldn’t remember who) were making attempts to prevent Youth
A and Youth B from harming others or themselves. Staff 4
reported seeing Youth A grab a piece of glass and sit down on the
floor. Staff 4 reported Staff 8 attempted to get the glass from
Youth A but denied seeing Staff 8 pull on Youth A.
Staff 12 was interviewed via telephone on 7/9/2025. Staff 12
reported being present the day of the incident. Staff 12 reported
being Staff 1’s supervisor at the time and reported Staff 1 was
upset during the incident because he felt as though staff members
were standing around instead of intervening. Staff 12 reported
Staff 1 did not push or pull-on Youth A. Staff 12 recalled hearing
about Staff 3’s inappropriate conduct during the incident but did
not witness it. Staff 12 reported Youth A and Youth B were
breaking glass and threatening staff. Staff 12 reported if staff
members pushed the youth, it was not to harm the youth but to
prevent them from harming themselves. Staff 12 denied
witnessing Staff 6 or Staff 7 pull or push on Youth A.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on 7/9/2025. Staff 6
reported being present during the incident. Staff 6 reported
observing Youth B attempting to climb through a broken window,
so he intervened. Staff 6 reported one side of the window was
covered with a piece of metal while the other side remained
broken. Staff 6 reported that he grabbed Youth B’s arm to pull her
down and, in the process, Youth B slid to the floor. Staff 6
reported this was the most appropriate intervention available at
the time, given Youth B’s quick movements and his concern for
4

her safety. Staff 6 also reported there was water on the floor,
which contributed to Youth B sliding down.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 7/9/25. Staff 5
reported being a trained CPI instructor and was able to identify
and intervene on Staff 3 during the incident. Staff 5 reported Youth
A was kicking and breaking glass from one of the windows in
Green Wing. Staff 5 reported Staff 3 was assisting with the
restraint but was holding Youth A too tightly and once Youth A
was released, Youth A kicked Staff 3. It was reported Staff 3
attempted to kick Youth A back. Staff 5 reported Staff 3 was
immediately removed from the unit for his behavior. Staff 5
reported he did not witness any other staff hit or push Youth A and
Youth B.
Video reviewed:
Video Footage of 3/18/2025 of DeRoy in Green Wing was
reviewed on 6/10/25. The video footage is 29.17 minutes long.
The video begins with Youth A, Youth B and Staff 4 entering the
living room area. Youth A and Youth B pull the fire alarm and then
walk away from it. Staff 4 go to the corner of the living room by the
door. Youth A and Youth B begin kicking the wall in the common
area. Staff 2 and another Staff 7 enter the living room, observe
Youth A and Youth B and then walk out of camera view. Youth B
pours a bottle of water onto the floor. Staff 5 enter the living room
and stands to observe the youth. Youth B walks off camera view
and then Youth A also walks off camera view. Staff 5 and Staff 7
follow Youth A off camera view. Staff 1 enters through the hallway
door, slips and falls in the water. Staff 1 gets up and goes back
into the hallway. Staff 4, Staff 5, and Staff 11 come back into the
living room after Staff 1 falls. Youth A reenters the living room with
a blue cloth in her hand and stands at the open hallway door with
Staff 4, Staff 5, and Staff 11. Staff 1 reenters the room with Youth
B. Youth A is observed punching Staff 1. Staff 1 blocks the punch
and grabs Youth A's hand to block. Staff 1 is also observed
ducking Youth A punches. Staff 1 grabs Youth A’s wrist with one
hand, put his other hand on her upper arm, and pushes Youth A
towards the corner of the living room. Staff 4 is on the other side
of Youth A when this occurs. Youth A tries to punch Staff 1 again
and then kicks him. Staff 4 tries to grab Youth A from behind.
Youth A continues to try and hit and kick Staff 1. Staff 1 and Staff
4 position themselves on either side of Youth A and look like they
are attempting to restrain Youth A, but it is unsuccessful due to
Youth A fighting against them. Staff 7 gets in front of Youth A, puts
her hand on Youth A’s chest and makes a forward motion. Staff 7
5

initially pushes Youth A backwards but then keeps her hand on
Youth A’s chest to hold her in place.
While four staff are addressing the situation with Youth A, Youth B
falls from the hallway door onto the floor in the living room. Youth
B gets up and goes back into the hallway (off camera). Staff 6 is
standing in the living room, reaches into the hallway, and then
pulls Youth B by her arm and down to the floor.
Staff 10, Staff 11, Staff 1, and Staff 5 surround Youth A. Staff 1
and Staff 5 position themselves on either side of Youth A. Staff 5
has one of his hands on top of Youth A’s shoulder. Youth A bends
over, but it is unclear whether she made this motion on her own or
whether Staff 1 and Staff 5 forced this position. Youth A is then
kneeling on the floor with Staff 1 and Staff 5 surrounding her.
There is a struggle, but it is unclear what they’re doing due to the
position of the camera angle. Once Youth A gets up from the
ground, Youth A punches Staff 1 in the face with a closed fist.
Staff 1, Staff 4, Staff 5, and Staff 7 intervene to separate Youth A
and Staff 1. Staff 5 holds Youth A’s wrist and upper arm, and
escorts Youth A away, and she proceeds to sit on top of a table in
the living room.
Youth B has something in her hand and goes over to the window
and begins a swinging motion. It is unclear what she is doing
because it is off the camera view. Staff 1 approaches Youth B,
who swings around, backs away from Staff 1, and goes to the
corner of the living room by the door. Youth B kicks the wall, walks
towards the middle of the living room, yells at staff, picks
something up off the floor, throws it onto the table, and backs
away. Youth A then picks up the object Youth B threw onto the
table, stands up and begins slamming it onto the table repeatedly.
She then throws the object across the table and Staff 1 retrieves
it. Youth B has a clipboard. Staff 5 grabs the clipboard out of
Youth B’s hand and backs away. Youth B goes over to Youth A
and stands in front of her. Youth B then walks towards Staff 1,
yells at him, then walks towards Youth A and talks to her, then
walks towards Staff 1 again and yells at him. Youth B then walks
away, grabs a cushion off the couch and continues walking
around the living room. Youth A is still sitting on the table in the
living room. Youth B begins kicking the walls throughout the living
room. Youth A stands up, goes over to the window and picks up
something off the ground, but it is unclear what she’s holding. She
holds it up, backs away from staff and stands in the corner by the
door. Youth B walks over to Youth A and stands next to her. Youth
A and Youth B lock arms at their elbows. Staff 2 picked up couch
6

cushions and provided those to surrounding staff. Staff 7, Staff 9,
Staff 10 enter the living room. Youth A and Youth B are still in the
corner. Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 5, and Staff 10 are standing back, but
surrounding them with couch cushions in hand. Youth A is seen
holding her hand up to her wrist and making a back and forth
motion, but it is unclear what she is doing. At least five staff (Staff
1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and other unknown staff) approach and
surround Youth A closer, but it is unclear what happens because
staff’s bodies are blocking the camera view. Youth B walks over to
the situation and attempts to get involved. Staff 4 and Staff 10 ran
over, placed their hands on Youth B, and Youth B yanked herself
away from them and walked away. All the staff surrounding Youth
A back away and disperse. Youth A comes out of the corner
flailing her arms and begins walking towards the other side of the
living room. Youth A begins kicking and hitting the window by the
camera and then goes out of camera view because she is under
the camera. Staff 10, Staff 5, Staff 2 and Staff 3 go near Youth A
while she is out of camera view. Staff 10 backs away, while Staff
2, Staff 3 and Staff 5 surround Youth A, who is still out of camera
view. It is unclear what they are doing, but there appears to be a
struggle of some sort. Staff 2 backs away, and Youth A appears
back in camera view. Youth A is seen kicking at Staff 3. Staff 3 is
seen going towards Youth A attempting to kick her back, however,
Staff 5 intervene and steps in between them. Staff 3 and Youth A
are then separated. Youth A sits on the living room table and Staff
3 leaves the living room. Youth A then moves to the corner
underneath the camera, which cannot be seen on camera view.
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 14 are seen surrounding her and
observing her. Youth A's arms come onto camera view, and it
appears she is holding something in one of her hands, but it is
unknown what. Youth A then makes a back-and-forth motion with
her hand against her other wrist. Staff 8 intervened, but it is
unknown what they are doing to Youth A or what Youth A is doing
as she is still off camera view. Staff 1 and Staff 2 grab couch
cushions and approach the corner, but then they set the cushions
on the living room couch. Youth A remains in the corner off-
camera view while staff begin to disperse. Youth B reenters the
living room area and walks towards the windows. Youth A gets out
of the corner and walks towards the windows as well. However,
due to the camera angle it is unclear what Youth A and Youth B
are doing, or which staff are surrounding them. Staff 8 and Staff 9
are seen restraining Youth A. Staff 2 switches out in the restraint
with female Staff 10. Youth A bends forward while being
restrained and then drops to the floor, so staff release the
restraint. Youth A is seen sitting on the floor while staff surround
her observing her. Staff 2 begins talking to Youth A and holds out
7

his hand towards her. Youth A puts her head in her hands while
sitting against the wall. Then she grabs paper or tissue off the
floor and wipes her eyes. Staff 2 remains talking to Youth A. Youth
A picks something up off the floor, but it is unclear what. She is
then seen using one of her hands making a back-and-forth motion
on her opposite wrist. Staff 2 stands up and gets in the way of the
camera view, so it is unknown what Youth A is doing or what staff
are doing. Youth A remains sitting on the floor until she finally gets
up and is escorted out of the area.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Staff 1's personnel file: Staff 1 had 7 disciplinary actions
in his employee file, unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1
was terminated due to a different investigation. Staff 1
completed Safety Care - Part 1 De-escalation on 9/17/24.
Staff 1 completed CPI Trainer Recertification on 2/20/25.
• Staff 2 personnel file: Staff 2 had 5 disciplinary actions in
his employee file, unrelated to this investigation. Staff 2
was terminated due to policy violation and not due to this
investigation. Staff 2 completed CPI-Nonviolent Crisis
Intervention Training on 10/2/24 and 10/3/24.
• Staff 3 personnel file: Staff 3 was terminated for this
investigation and a previous investigation. There were no
other disciplinary actions on file. Staff 3 completed CPI
Nonviolent Physical Crisis intervention on 2/24/25 and
2/25/25.
• Staff 6 personnel file: There is no disciplinary record. Staff
6 completed CPI training on 9/13/24.
• Staff 7 personnel file: There is no disciplinary record. Staff
7 completed CPI training on 5/12/25 and 5/13/25.
• Incident Report #3148 dated 3/18/25 authored by Staff 11
documented the incident but was not consistent with
interviews. Incident report indicated Youth A and Youth B
were questioned about whispering and were asked to stop
whispering. Youth B asked for some water in which she
threw on the floor. Youth A and Youth B pulled the fire
alarm and tried to escape through a window. Youth A was
restrained after taking a piece of glass broken during an
incident by Youth A and Youth B. Youth A was transported
to the hospital for self-inflicted wounds.
• Critical Incidents POL- 005-007: This policy instructs staff
on how to recognize critical incidents and take appropriate
steps to prevent them.
• Incidents and Emergencies POL-014-035: This policy
documents what incidents must be report immediately and
who the incidents are to be reported to.
8

• Policy 005-010 – Behavior Management: This policy
states physical intervention shall not be used as a form of
coercion, discipline, convenience, or retaliation by staff.
• Policy POL-022-114 – Employee Behavior:
This policy prohibits staff behavior such as fighting,
assaulting, threatening, or intimidating clients.
• Policy POL-022-406 – Staff and Client Interaction:
Staff are expected to maintain professional and appropriate
conduct in all interactions with clients. Employees must
foster mutual trust and establish positive working
relationships. The policy explicitly states corporal
punishment including spanking, paddling, slapping,
pinching, twisting arms, or pulling hair is strictly prohibited
under any circumstances.
Analysis The agency was found to be in non-compliance as per video
reviewed, multiple staff violated the rule by kicking, pushing, or
pulling Youth A and Youth B during the incident (as described
below).
- Per video reviewed, Staff 1 grabbed Youth A’s wrist with
one hand, put his other hand on Youth A’s upper arm and
pushed Youth A. Staff 4 confirmed Staff 1 pushed Youth A,
and stated it was a reflex to Youth A punching Staff 1.
- Per video reviewed, Staff 6 was observed pulling Youth B
down from a window. During Staff 6’s interview, he
admitted to doing this and stated he did it to prevent Youth
B from harming herself on the broken glass in the window.
- Per video reviewed, Staff 3 was observed moving towards
Youth A to kick her, which was confirmed during Staff 5 and
Staff 14’s interviews.
- Per interviews with Staff 2 and Staff 5, Staff 3 was
observed holding Youth A too tight during the restraint,
which led to Staff 2 intervening and directing Staff 3 to walk
away.
- Per video reviewed, Staff 7 pushed Youth A backwards but
then kept her hand on Youth A’s chest to hold her in place.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
- Staff should be retrained on the tap-out method and how to
alleviate team members from incidents before further
escalation. Per the video, several staff members were
observed standing and watching the incident but not
intervening.
- Staff should prioritize sweeping up glass and other debris
quickly to avoid continued and prolonged safety hazards
during crisis incidents.
9

- Incident Reports should document all individuals who were
involved in or observed the incident. Initially in Staff 1, Staff
2 and Staff 3’s interviews, they reported no other staff
members were involved in the incident. However, according
to video footage reviewed, there were several staff
members involved who were not documented on the
incident report, but observed and/or played a crucial role
during the incident with Youth A and Youth B.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR# 2025SIC0000556 dated 6/10/25; CAP pending
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health Services; policies and procedures
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health services
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and Emergency medical, and dental, and
behavioral health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The youth did not receive medical attention. The youth will tell
staff she is depressed and wants to harm or kill herself and staff
will not call the police or follow protocols. The youth will ask to call
a hotline or go to the hospital and staff refuse these requests.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at Vista Maria on
4/21/25. Youth A reported she told Staff 2 about the injury to her
back, but did not receive medical attention. Youth A reported later
the same day she lied about swallowing a nail to receive medical
attention. Youth A reported she received medical attention after
lying about swallowing the nail. Youth A reported when she is
depressed and wants to harm herself, she is denied medical
attention. Youth A reported in December she wanted to go to the
hospital after threatening suicide and was denied the opportunity
(couldn’t remember which staff denied her) to call the hotline or to
go to the hospital. Youth A did not report being denied mental
health services, denied emergency treatment for suicidal
thoughts/ideations, or being denied her request to call a hotline
any other times.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at Vista Maria on 4/30/25
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B reported she was
not present to witness the incident with Youth A. When asked
about the facility’s promptness in getting youth medical attention,
Youth B reported one time her ankle was stepped on during an
altercation, and she denied receiving medical attention at first (SIR
#2025SIC0000571). However, at the end of the interview, she
disclosed she did in fact receive medical attention.
10

Youth C was interviewed via face to face at Vista Maria on
4/21/25. Youth C reported Youth A was offered medical attention
but declined. Youth C reported when she is in a crisis and needs
support, she can tell her therapist or another staff. Youth C
reported receiving medical and mental health support when
needed.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at Vista Maria on
4/21/25. Therapist reported Youth A participates in weekly
individual therapy. Therapist denied Youth A told her about the
pain in her arm or head. Therapist reported youth at the facility
receive medical exams when necessary. Therapist reported she is
not aware of, and has never been told, Youth A has been denied
medical treatment or mental health treatment. Therapist reported
Youth A receives emergency medical treatment when needed.
Staff 1 was interviewed via face to face on 5/1/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A was observed with
wounds on her arms. Staff 1 reported Youth A received medical
treatment for her arm. However, Staff 1 reported Youth A did not
report any injuries to her head or hands or her back. Staff 1
reported Youth A punched the walls during this incident, so her
injuries to her hand could have occurred at that time. Staff 1
reported a protocol must be followed when youth report suicide.
Staff 1 reported an incident report is completed, contact with the
nurse occurs, and Consumer’s Rights Advocate is also notified.
Staff 1 reported Youth A has never disclosed suicidal thoughts to
him. Staff 1 reported it’s normally up to the nurse to decide if
Youth should see a doctor. Staff 1 reported Youth are assessed
by a nurse first.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at Vista Maria on 5/1/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 reported there is a
protocol to use when Youth make threats of suicide. Staff 2 was
familiar with the protocol and reported an incident report is
completed and the nurse on duty is notified.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 7/9/2025. Staff 4
reported Youth A received medical attention for this incident.
Documentation:
• Medical Record dated 3/18/25. Record indicate Youth A
self-harmed. A superficial bilateral cut was seen on her
forearm. There was a small cut on her thumb and knuckle.
Report indicated Youth A’s wound was cleaned with alcohol
and antibacterial ointment. There were no further
11

complications reported during this visit. The report did not
mention injuries to the Youth back.
• Garden City Hospital discharge paperwork for Youth A.
This document shows Youth medical treatment on 3/18/25
for a finger laceration.
• Incident report dated 12/22/24 documents Youth A’s self-
harm crisis. Youth A was found scratching old scars on her
arm. There were several old scars scratched open, but no
bleeding was seen.
• Suicide Risk Assessment Tool for Residential Youth
dated 12/23/24: Youth A suicide risk was assessed and
Youth A denied having suicidal thoughts.
• Suicide Prevention Policy: This policy outlines what steps
staff should take to prevent suicide among the clients,
which includes placing youth in a restraint if they are unable
to be de-escalated, begin 100% visual monitoring with
documentation, make appropriate notifications to various
parties, complete the suicide assessment tool, and have
youth go to the hospital if youth is high risk (and as
recommended by supervisor).
• Emergency Medical Care: Per this policy, if a client
becomes seriously ill or injured, the shift Supervisor and or
Team Leader must take prompt steps to obtain medical
care for the client.
• Life-threatening illness/injury: The supervisor must
immediately call 911 if a client appears to have a life-
threatening or critical illness or injury.
• Reporting Client Medical Concerns: Emergencies: If a
client has a medical emergency, refer to the POL-005-004,
Emergency Medical Care for Clients.
- Non-emergencies: If a client has a non-emergent
medical concern, e.g., headache, sore throat,
menstrual cramps, etc., the supervisor is responsible
for handling the matter as soon as possible. This
may include contacting the building nurse and/or
administering prescribed medication to the client.
- If required, Vista Maria is prepared to treat client
injuries by maintaining access to poison control
information and having first aid supplies and
manuals in all residential buildings and in the Health
Services Clinic, refer to POL-008-019, First Aid
treatment.
- After hours and weekends: If the supervisor deems it
necessary, the on-call nurse or the designee will be
contacted for further assistance.
12

Analysis The agency was found to be in compliance. Youth A initially
reported she did not receive medical attention for the injuries she
received during the altercation with Staff 1 and Staff 2. However,
medical discharge paperwork documents Youth A’s visit to the
hospital and the medical attention received on her finger. Youth A
also later reported she received medical attention. Youth A
reported she does not receive mental health treatment when
needed. Per interviews conducted and documentation reviewed,
Youth A has received mental health treatment and assessment.
Conclusion Violation Not Established.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Additional Finding of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 3 used derogatory language towards Youth A.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face on 4/21/25 at Vista
Maria. Youth A denied Staff 1 and Staff 2 used derogatory
